title: Intel’s first Arc GPUs have finally arrived — here’s what you need to know
content:
Not to be melodramatic, today might be one of the most important days in PC gaming history. Intel is launching its first batch of Arc GPUs today, adding a third major competitor to a market that’s been dominated by Nvidia and AMD (or ATI, back in the day) for as long as many gamers and creators can remember. Now the question is just whether Intel’s discrete GPUs are any good.  I’ll go ahead and warn you right away that Intel didn’t provide any hard comparisons with its competitors; we’ll have to wait for real-world benchmarks for those. Still, there’s a…

This story continues at The Next Web

Or just read more coverage about: Intel
description: Intel's first Arc GPUs have arrived. Although only the lowest tier of laptop GPUs are launching for now, there's a lot more to come.
